channel.title: Ultimate vps guide with pics
channel.description:
Too many people are asking about how to get a vps
which is good in a way, because that means more people are starting to take server more company like. But it's bad because that just adds to the questions...Well ill show you the basics to getting a vps
[color=teal]First off, some people ask, what is a VPS?
Well a VPS is basically, a computer, your connecting to that is somewhere in the world. That you can login to and control and do what ever you want. If you know what TeamVierwer. And it's all yours. Most VPS are used for a company.
Keep in mind, you can connect to your VPS anywhere, so if for some reason you move or your main computer crashers, you can still get on it.[/color]
STEP 1: BUYING A VPS STEP 2: LOGGING INTO VPS STEP 3: HELP WITH VPS
STEP 1: The main part about a VPS is making sure you purchase a good one. If you server is just starting out and has about 20-30 players on it i recommend buying one from vpsland.com
They sell a cheap vps, and its a very good company.
Im not going to show you how to create an account on there and how your going to buy it and such...but i will show you what is a good vps and what is a bad vps...
Some people buy a linux vps, and these are good for if you know linux well...if not don't buy one.
A lot of people when buying a vps seem to waste money, they think they need to buy a 6gb vps and spend $150 a month on a server with about 8 players on.
You cant really tell when your gonna get lag from so many players, because it all depends on all the stuff on your server Ex: more customs= more lagg
A 1gb vps can host about 38 players with no lagg.
Once you buy your vps, it takes sometime for it to get setup, www.vpsland.com takes about 24 hours, but it is totally worth it! Once your vps is set up, they will email you your login settings. They will send you a email that says what IP to connect to and username
THIS WILL TAKE ATLEAST 24 HOURS!!!
I will be showing you what to do with vpsland.com on a windows server
Go to run then once you open run type in MSTSC. Then something that looks like this will pop up. (Start>Run>MSTSC)
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/1ny0ev.png[/img]
You then type in the ip and username that they sent in the email.
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/1sl3it.png[/img]
You Will then see another login and you type in administrator as your username and what ever password you made during the process of making your account on the website.
Step 3: Help with Your VPS
As a lot of you may figure out a VPS is just a computer your connecting to. Like a brand new Computer, so that means you have to download all of your server files and everything. I recommend putting your files on megaupload and then get on your VPS to download them.
[size=14pt]I Hope This Guide Helped, If you have anymore questions, talk to me threw msn at lukedawesome@hotmail.com[/size]

item.title: Ultimate vps guide with pics
item.dc:creator: @ou08tlaw ou08tlaw
item.description:
@ou08tlaw wrote:

meher:

So uh…after i’ve done everything about this. And I shutdown my computer, will the server still be hosted online?

First off, some people ask, what is a VPS?

Well a VPS is basically, a computer, your connecting to that is somewhere in the world. That you can login to and control and do what ever you want. If you know what TeamVierwer. And it’s all yours. Most VPS are used for a company.

Keep in mind, you can connect to your VPS anywhere, so if for some reason you move or your main computer crashers, you can still get on it.

item.title: Ultimate vps guide with pics
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Berky-Scape:

Is this for Windows and Linux? Because I doubt that it’s for Linux.

Windows obviously. It says that in the thread.

Anyways, Nice tutorial, had to find this out for myself. One thing I might add would be that you should buy a VPS with a cPanel. If you don’t get one with a cPanel, you will be very sorry unless you know how to work with Putty. Santrex is also a good VPS company, Google it if you don’t know what it is. They sell off-shore vps’ which, from personal experience, are a lot better than on-shore hosted vps’. Santrex has supreme customer service, and they are much cheaper than VpsLand.

That’s my two cents.

Read full topic

@rash wrote:

[quote=“emtrescue, post:139, topic:332813”][quote author=12igon8 link=topic=429240.msg3631458#msg3631458 date=1308256687]

part of this is very wrong, a vps is not a computer a vps is vitrual it is not a computer, it looks acts like one but it is not one… everything that a vps is is all citrual thats why it stays up 24/7 no crashes or anything it is NOT a computer get the facts right

You’re an idiot.

I was using an example for people to understand.
[/quote]

if your going to make a tut about a vps, than dont lie about what it is or it shows you know nothnig abot a vps[/quote]
